JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP and NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

From CARDINAL DATE ORG ( the “ ORG ” ) paid the applicant an invalidity pension based on a bilateral agreement between GPE and GPE ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) and informed him that he was to disclose any changes in his address as the pension entitlement depended on him continuing to reside in GPE .
On DATE ORG received an anonymous letter that the applicant had transferred his domicile to GPE and that he only travelled to GPE to receive his pension .
On DATE ORG asked the applicant whether his permanent domicile was in GPE or in GPE , but the applicant failed to provide the required information .
On DATE the NORP registration office ( PERSON ) informed ORG that since CARDINAL DATE the applicant had been domiciled in Bydgoszcz .

On DATE ORG informed the applicant of its intention to cease the payment of the invalidity pension as of DATE . Moreover , it ordered him to reimburse the payments effected between CARDINAL DATE and DATE amounting to some DEM CARDINAL,CARDINAL . ORG served its decision on the applicant ’s address in GPE . The applicant ’s wife acknowledged receipt of the decision .
On DATE the applicant lodged an administrative appeal against that decision . He alleged inter alia that he had not received the decision as he no longer lived with his wife .
On DATE , relying on the information provided by the ORG registration office about the applicant ’s domicile , ORG rejected the administrative appeal .
On DATE the applicant brought an action before ORG to have the decision of ORG annulled .
On DATE ORG requested ORG to hear CARDINAL witnesses .
On DATE the ORG heard those witnesses . The applicant , although he had been informed of the hearing , did not appear .
On DATE the applicant lodged his application before the ORG .
On DATE the applicant received ORG summons to the hearing scheduled for CARDINAL DATE .
On CARDINAL DATE ORG held the hearing , which the applicant did not attend , and dismissed the applicant ’s action , arguing that he had acted with gross negligence .
The judgment was served on the applicant by post .
On DATE and on CARDINAL DATE the ORG requested the applicant to inform the ORG about the outcome of the proceedings before ORG .
On DATE the ORG received the applicant ’s letter in which he , without further comments , submitted a copy of ORG judgment .
On DATE ORG informed the ORG that the judgment of ORG had not yet become final as the applicant had not returned the acknowledgment of the judgment ’s receipt to ORG .

This bilateral agreement establishes that persons who moved to GPE by DATE could receive their pension from a NORP insurance company . The agreement applies only as long as the pensioner has his domicile in GPE .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW administrative appeals and actions for annulment have suspensive effect . Administrative acts may only be enforced if they have become final or if legal remedies to challenge these acts have no suspensive effect .
The NORP law does not provide for a party to pay interest in cases where he or she is found liable to reimburse unlawfully obtained pension payments .
